summary: The British Virgin Islands (BVI) are a group of islands in the Caribbean Sea, east of Puerto Rico. They are a British territory and part of the larger Virgin Islands group. The BVI include four main islands: Tortola, Virgin Gorda, Anegada, and Jost Van Dyke, plus over 50 smaller ones. About 16 of these islands have people living on them. The capital, Road Town, is on Tortola, the biggest island. In 2010, around 28,000 people lived in the BVI, with most on Tortola. People from these islands are British citizens.
title: British Virgin Islands
